name: writable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of a computer disk) able to have new information written and stored on it by a user: The computer was introduced in 1997 with a CD-ROM drive but no floppy disk drive or other writable media device. Since the advent of cloud computing, we have less need to use writable disks to store our data. You can back up your videos with an external hard drive or on a writeable CD .
More examplesFewer examplesThe scanning program can be run to check for viruses on any writable media used with your computer, as well as its hard disk. If you reboot now, the disk will be writable to all users.

able to be written, or written on: There are so many hours in a day, and I can only find about a page of writable stuff. The price for the device doesn't include a writeable screen.
More examplesFewer examplesIt's a kind of writeable, low-power notepad, rather like an electronic sticky note.
